cz.zcu.kiv.dfs_simulator.view.content

Class FxModelNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
              • cz.zcu.kiv.dfs_simulator.view.content.FxModelNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StatePersistable, GraphDisplayable, Draggable, Highlightable, MultiSelectable, MultiSelectableDraggable, Selectable, Labelable, java.io.Serializable, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FxModelClientNode, FxModelServerNode

    public abstract class FxModelNode
extends javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
implements GraphDisplayable
    Graphical node.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        protected javafx.scene.shape.Circle getActualLinkPointCircle(double x,
                                                             double y,
                                                             double radius)
        Get actual (invisible) connection point. Point has all handlers (listeners) already set.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        radius - point radius
        Returns:
        connection point

      • getLinkPointCircle

        protected javafx.scene.shape.Circle getLinkPointCircle(double x,
                                                       double y,
                                                       double radius)
        Get visible connection point. Does not have any function other than displaying user where the center of actual connection points is.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        radius - visible point radius
        Returns:
        visible connection point

      • getLinkBorders

        protected javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getLinkBorders()
        Get connection box borders. Borders run through connection points. Borders do not handle mouse events.
        Returns:
        link borders

        public void handleNodeDropCreated()
        Handle case when this node was created by drag and drop event. Displays connection point - since mouse cursor is already over this node, connection box would not be displayed without exiting node first.

        InvalidPersistedStateException - can be thrown when state has invalid values.
